title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Design of Type 1 Diabetes Blood Glucose Management System

context.prior_knowledge: Diabetes physiology, insulin therapy principles, basic machine learning, and reinforcement learning concepts
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented training program for medical technology professionals, utilizing FDA-approved simulators and BYOD (personal devices) for practical settings

learning_goals: Acquiring the ability to design reward functions for blood glucose control systems using reinforcement learning algorithms
Mastering performance evaluation methods for artificial pancreas systems using the UVA/Padova simulator
Cultivating the ability to apply discount factor optimization techniques for personalized insulin sensitivity

resources: Reinforcement Learning Implementation Tools (e.g., OpenAI Gym)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
